messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] One last question Re: Sleeve Insignia
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, to both you and Barbara.  =)  I wasn t being impatient.  I did some thinking and for what I would like the insignia for, actual size isn t necessary.
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, to both you and Barbara. =) I wasn't being
impatient. I did some thinking and for what I would
like the insignia for, actual size isn't necessary.

Barbara, if you're reading this the screencap would be
awesome.

Thanks again, everyone.

I just found out my old friend from JHS is in Japan
doing JET. I'm going to see if I can get him to pick
up the book in person for me - if he's up to a trip to
the museum, that is.

-M



____________________________________________________

http://www.yahoo.com/r/hs

messages.subject: One last question Re: Sleeve Insignia
messages.msgSnippet: https://mywebspace.wisc.edu/tnamwong/web/28.jpg Michael, I didn t forget, please be patient the explanation for the sleeve insignia, in English, did not
messages.messageBody:
https://mywebspace.wisc.edu/tnamwong/web/28.jpg
Michael, I didn't forget, please be patient
the explanation for the sleeve insignia, in English, did not mention
dimensions

none of the images were scanned with that kind of resolution

you can get a copy of the book yourself---I did (^_^) and I'm in the
states.


--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "michaelcarcana" <michaelcarcana@y...> wrote:
> Ok, I've kind of given up on getting the actual dimensions. Just one
> last request if someone can actually get the exhibit book. I'd like a
> high res scan of the page whenever it could be had (since my
> interpretation of my translated search implies I can't get a copy of
> the book myself). I'd just like a really, really sharp version of it
> without the pixelation. Maybe like 600 DPI or so. If it can be done,
> awesome. If not, thanks for taking the time to read this post.
>
> =M

messages.subject: One last question Re: Sleeve Insignia
messages.msgSnippet: Ok, I ve kind of given up on getting the actual dimensions.  Just one last request if someone can actually get the exhibit book.  I d like a high res scan of
messages.messageBody:
Ok, I've kind of given up on getting the actual dimensions. Just one
last request if someone can actually get the exhibit book. I'd like a
high res scan of the page whenever it could be had (since my
interpretation of my translated search implies I can't get a copy of
the book myself). I'd just like a really, really sharp version of it
without the pixelation. Maybe like 600 DPI or so. If it can be done,
awesome. If not, thanks for taking the time to read this post.

=M
